<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/03/warner-bros-release-2021-films-theaters-hbo-max?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How Would You Like to Take This Home?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A close-up gif of Timothee Chalamet in "Dune" staring off into the distance" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/cmIBKv6BpofWUPPmKU/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='A close-up gif of Timothee Chalamet in "Dune" staring off into the distance' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/cmIBKv6BpofWUPPmKU/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Next year, you can. In an announcement that shook the film industry, Warner Bros., a subsidiary of AT&T's WarnerMedia, said it will release its 2021 movies on AT&T's streaming service, HBO Max, at the <a href="https://variety.com/2020/film/news/warner-bros-hbo-max-theaters-dune-matrix-4-1234845342/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">same time</a> they debut in theaters. Those films include <em>Dune</em>, <em>The Matrix 4</em>, and <em>In the Heights</em>, and they won't cost HBO Max subscribers anything extra. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>After 31 days on HBO Max, movies will be exclusive to theaters until they ship out to a Roku near you. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Warner Bros. was already planning a hybrid release for <em>Wonder Woman 1984 </em>on Christmas Day. But with the pandemic getting worse and theater attendance looking sadder than a concession stand with nothing but Raisinets, the studio is cozying up to customers at home. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Warner Bros. tried a traditional release of </span><span><em>Tenet </em></span><span>this September, but this announcement tells you all you need to know about how that went.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The move is a boost for HBO Max, which launched this spring and is still waiting for its Baby Yoda moment. Until yesterday, "HBO Max didn't have a brand beyond 'HBO plus other random stuff.' Now it most definitely has a real brand that makes sense to real people: Big movies in your house, no waiting," Recode's Peter Kafka <a href="https://twitter.com/pkafka/status/1334576893526470658?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Theaters are losing hope for a Christmas miracle</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">AMC stock fell 16% and Cinemark's 22% following the news, capping off a devastating nine-month streak for theater chains. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But even before the pandemic, traditional theatrical releases <a href="https://www.matthewball.vc/all/covidmovies?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">faced pressure</a> from streamers like Netflix. While WarnerMedia CEO Ann Sarnoff said this is a "unique one-year plan" because of Covid-19...some are convinced this direct-to-consumer model could signal a permanent change in film debuts.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In April, the </span><span><em>Trolls</em></span><span> sequel </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/28/trolls-sequel-reportedly-brings-96-million-digital-release?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pulled</a></span><span> in $95 million from digital rentals in three weeks, beating out what the original earned in five months in theaters. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The big question: </strong>Even after the pandemic is under control, will consumers want to return to theaters and play elbow hockey with strangers?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/03/blackrock-alums-named-bidens-cabinet-generate-controversy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
BlackRocks the White House
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Joe Biden's nominee for head of the National Economic Council, Brian Deese " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzA0L2JyaWFuX2RlZXNlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>MANDEL NGAN/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, President-elect Joe Biden <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/biden-transition-updates/2020/12/03/942205555/biden-names-blackrocks-brian-deese-as-his-top-economic-aide?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">named</a> Brian Deese, head of sustainable investing at asset manager BlackRock, to helm the National Economic Council (NEC). Deese is the second Rocker to join Biden’s cabinet; on Tuesday, Wally Adeyemo, a former chief of staff to BlackRock’s CEO, was named Biden’s nominee for second-in-command at the Treasury. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Deese worked at the NEC under former President Obama, where he helped form the auto bailout of 2008. This time around, he’ll be tasked with getting the U.S. back into the Paris climate agreement. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What it means: </strong>The clipboard crowd isn’t happy. Some environmental advocates accuse BlackRock of “financing environmental devastation.” But activist and arguably clipboarder-in-chief Bill McKibben <a href="https://twitter.com/billmckibben/status/1331945316988432389?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">defended</a> Deese’s commitment to climate policy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Brooks Brothers crowd is even more pleased. Biden's picks “can help assuage financial executives’ concerns. It sends a clear signal to the industry to breathe easier,” executive director of investor group Healthy Markets Association Tyler Gellasch <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/blackrock-emerges-as-wall-street-player-in-biden-administration-11606841207?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the WSJ</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Losing execs to the White House reflects BlackRock’s growing influence. It’s the world’s largest asset manager, with $7.8 trillion in assets under management as of September. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">

</a>
</td>
</tr>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID-19
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/03/california-implements-new-round-strict-covid19-restrictions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
California, You’re Going Home
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Sophie Turner saying "All you have to do is stay home and get drunk" to Conan O'Brian" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=331 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/JNst2oJ0NT6yjnpMsw/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Sophie Turner saying " All you have to do is stay home and get drunk" to Conan O'Brian" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/JNst2oJ0NT6yjnpMsw/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, CA Gov. Gavin Newsom <a href="https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-12-03/newsom-weighs-shutdown-california-covid-19-cases-soar-december?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">issued</a> new limits on Californians’ daily activities in order to bring down the rising number of Covid-19 infections. That means curbs on community outings and in-person shopping for at least 21 days in certain regions where ICU capacity drops below 15%.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Eleven counties in Southern California and 12 in the Central Valley could be subject to those restrictions as soon as today. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Personal service businesses such as campgrounds and nail salons in those counties will have to close up shop. Restaurants will have to return to takeout-only, and retail stores will be limited to 20% capacity. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>You can lead a horse to water, but it’s trickier to make it stay indoors—the growing infection numbers <a href="https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-12-03/california-stay-at-home-order-resistance?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suggest</a> Californians are getting weary of Covid-19 restrictions. Cities including Beverly Hills are even thinking about creating their own public health departments to push back on county orders. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

</h3>

</h1>

<a href="https://invest.trygatsby.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=12_11" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Gatsby" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMjAzMC8xNjA2MDc4MTY5LWdhdHNieV9iYWNrZ3JvdW5kX2xpbmtlZGluLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Surprise, surprise. I bet you thought we loved stocks. Well, not exactly. Stonks are 2020, but investing in the platform <em>itself </em>is a meta concept for unlocking the next wave of gains. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Enter <a href="https://invest.trygatsby.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=12_11" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Gatsby</a>, the <a href="https://invest.trygatsby.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=12_11" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">options trading platform</a> for a new generation of investors. <strong style="color:#000">The options market is growing right now, and investors are using Gatsby to leverage the powerful investment vehicle in a digestible, responsible way.</strong> The market has had over $14 trillion (with a T!) of options contracts traded in 2019—and 2020 is on pace to shatter that.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And now you can <a href="https://invest.trygatsby.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=12_11" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invest in this fintech revolution</a> by investing in Gatsby directly. Since launching a year ago, more than 200k contracts have been traded on their platform—that’s more than $50m of transactions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cash in on the people revolutionizing the options market and <a href="https://invest.trygatsby.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=12_11" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invest with Gatsby today</a>. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
OIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/03/opec-compromises-january-oil-production-hike?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
OPEC+ Strikes Oil
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Game of Risk, played in oil barrels " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzkyL2dhbWVfb2Zfcmlza19wbGF5ZWRfaW5fb2lsX2JhcnJlbHMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday afternoon, OPEC+ <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/03/opec-meeting-talks-resume-over-oil-production-cuts-amid-covid-crisis.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">eked out an agreement</a> to increase the output of its 23 members by 500,000 barrels/day come January. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What’s OPEC+? </strong></span><span>Not a streaming service, a group of oil-producing countries that accounts for about half of global production.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How we got here</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Early March: </strong>Pandemic lockdowns crushed demand for fuel, sending oil prices down nearly a quarter. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">April: </strong>Oil futures hit negative territory for the first time, underscoring oversupply in the market. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">May: </strong>OPEC+ decided to cut output by 9.7 million barrels/day to prop up prices. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">August:</strong> The group eased cuts to 7.7 million/day.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Now: </strong>Negotiations broke down earlier this week as some OPEC+ nations (including Saudi Arabia) tried extending cuts through Q1 and others pushed for greater compliance from members. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The compromise will keep the oil market in a deficit, helping producers burn through extra inventory.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom in: </strong>Oil prices may feel abstract, but their 2020 tumble has very real consequences. Yesterday, Chevron shaved up to $6 billion off its budget. In all, big oil companies have written down ~$80 billion in assets this year, <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-chevron-outlook/chevron-tightens-belt-again-with-billions-in-spending-cuts-idUSKBN28D20W?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Reuters reports</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve got to run a chess puzzle at some point, right? Don’t worry—you don’t need to know how to actually play the game to solve this puzzle. You just need to put your brain to work.</p>

Home?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A close-up gif of Timothee Chalamet in \"Dune\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNext year, you can. In an announcement that shook the film industry, Warner Bros., a subsidiary of AT\u0026T's WarnerMedia, said it will release its 2021 movies on AT\u0026T's streaming service, HBO Max, at the \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2020/film/news/warner-bros-hbo-max-theaters-dune-matrix-4-1234845342/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esame time\u003c/a\u003e they debut in theaters. Those films include \u003cem\u003eDune\u003c/em\u003e, \u003cem\u003eThe Matrix 4\u003c/em\u003e, and \u003cem\u003eIn the Heights\u003c/em\u003e, and they won't cost HBO Max subscribers anything extra. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter 31 days on HBO Max, movies will be exclusive to theaters until they ship out to a Roku near you. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWarner Bros. was already planning a hybrid release for \u003cem\u003eWonder Woman 1984 \u003c/em\u003eon Christmas Day. But with the pandemic getting worse and theater attendance looking sadder than a concession stand with nothing but Raisinets, the studio is cozying up to customers at home. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWarner Bros. tried a traditional release of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eTenet \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethis September, but this announcement tells you all you need to know about how that went.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe move is a boost for HBO Max, which launched this spring and is still waiting for its Baby Yoda moment. Until yesterday, \"HBO Max didn't have a brand beyond 'HBO plus other random stuff.' Now it most definitely has a real brand that makes sense to real people: Big movies in your house, no waiting,\" Recode's Peter Kafka \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/pkafka/status/1334576893526470658?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTheaters are losing hope for a Christmas miracle\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAMC stock fell 16% and Cinemark's 22% following the news, capping off a devastating nine-month streak for theater chains. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut even before the pandemic, traditional theatrical releases \u003ca href=\"https://www.matthewball.vc/all/covidmovies?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efaced pressure\u003c/a\u003e from streamers like Netflix. While WarnerMedia CEO Ann Sarnoff said this is a \"unique one-year plan\" because of Covid-19...some are convinced this direct-to-consumer model could signal a permanent change in film debuts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn April, the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eTrolls\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e sequel \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/28/trolls-sequel-reportedly-brings-96-million-digital-release?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epulled\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in $95 million from digital rentals in three weeks, beating out what the original earned in five months in theaters. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe big question: \u003c/strong\u003eEven after the pandemic is under control, will consumers want to return to theaters and play elbow hockey with strangers?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" House\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Joe Biden's nominee for head of the National Economic Council, Brian src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzA0L2JyaWFuX2RlZXNlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMANDEL NGAN/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, President-elect Joe Biden \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/biden-transition-updates/2020/12/03/942205555/biden-names-blackrocks-brian-deese-as-his-top-economic-aide?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enamed\u003c/a\u003e Brian Deese, head of sustainable investing at asset manager BlackRock, to helm the National Economic Council (NEC). Deese is the second Rocker to join Biden’s cabinet; on Tuesday, Wally Adeyemo, a former chief of staff to BlackRock’s CEO, was named Biden’s nominee for second-in-command at the Treasury. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDeese worked at the NEC under former President Obama, where he helped form the auto bailout of 2008. This time around, he’ll be tasked with getting the U.S. back into the Paris climate agreement. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat it means: \u003c/strong\u003eThe clipboard crowd isn’t happy. Some environmental advocates accuse BlackRock of “financing environmental devastation.” But activist and arguably clipboarder-in-chief Bill McKibben \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/billmckibben/status/1331945316988432389?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edefended\u003c/a\u003e Deese’s commitment to climate policy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Brooks Brothers crowd is even more pleased. Biden's picks “can help assuage financial executives’ concerns. It sends a clear signal to the industry to breathe easier,” executive director of investor group Healthy Markets Association Tyler Gellasch \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/blackrock-emerges-as-wall-street-player-in-biden-administration-11606841207?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eLosing execs to the White House reflects BlackRock’s growing influence. It’s the world’s largest asset manager, with $7.8 trillion in assets under management as of September. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, CA Gov. Gavin Newsom \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-12-03/newsom-weighs-shutdown-california-covid-19-cases-soar-december?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eissued\u003c/a\u003e new limits on Californians’ daily activities in order to bring down the rising number of Covid-19 infections. That means curbs on community outings and in-person shopping for at least 21 days in certain regions where ICU capacity drops below 15%.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEleven counties in Southern California and 12 in the Central Valley could be subject to those restrictions as soon as today. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePersonal service businesses such as campgrounds and nail salons in those counties will have to close up shop. Restaurants will have to return to takeout-only, and retail stores will be limited to 20% capacity. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eYou can lead a horse to water, but it’s trickier to make it stay indoors—the growing infection numbers \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-12-03/california-stay-at-home-order-resistance?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuggest\u003c/a\u003e Californians are getting weary of Covid-19 restrictions. Cities including Beverly Hills are even thinking about creating their own public health departments to push back on county orders. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEarly March: \u003c/strong\u003ePandemic lockdowns crushed demand for fuel, sending oil prices down nearly a quarter. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eApril: \u003c/strong\u003eOil futures hit negative territory for the first time, underscoring oversupply in the market. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMay: \u003c/strong\u003eOPEC+ decided to cut output by 9.7 million barrels/day to prop up prices. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAugust:\u003c/strong\u003e The group eased cuts to 7.7 million/day.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNow: \u003c/strong\u003eNegotiations broke down earlier this week as some OPEC+ nations (including Saudi Arabia) tried extending cuts through Q1 and others pushed for greater compliance from members. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe compromise will keep the oil market in a deficit, helping producers burn through extra inventory.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom in: \u003c/strong\u003eOil prices may feel abstract, but their 2020 tumble has very real consequences. Yesterday, Chevron shaved up to $6 billion off its budget. In all, big oil companies have written down ~$80 billion in assets this year, \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-chevron-outlook/chevron-tightens-belt-again-with-billions-in-spending-cuts-idUSKBN28D20W?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eReuters reports\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable
